data.title: Good drinks on a hot day
data.text: $3- Buds, can't beat it on a hot Scottsdale day.  In the Old Town section of town.  Good Margarita too!

data.title: Super Cool "DIVE" bar!
data.text: This was a super fun place to stop on our bike tour.   It was a bit dingy and smelly but great service and a funky place to be.  They say the locals all go hang out there on Christmas night after dinner.   It was a real blast!

data.title: Meh.
data.text: Might be a bit too old for this place.  Bartenders were great, poured good drinks.  Crowd seemed dominated by those just over the legal drinking age. Perhaps would have enjoyed it more if I played billiards or ping pong (the other half of the bar).  Interesting people watching...maybe.  Will try Rusty Spur next time.

data.title: Awesome dive!
data.text: Service was top notch, ping pong and shuffleboard were old--but free and fun. Cheap beers, great atmosphere. Great break from the other places around there.

data.title: Yuck
data.text: My wife and I came here with some friends. It was so overly crowded you couldn't even walk through the back area. We wouldn't come here again

data.title: Great dive bar
data.text: This place is awesome if you like a good dive bar. The drinks are reasonably priced. The sound system is good. The bartenders are friendly. What more could you ask for?

data.title: Great place for ????
data.text: Hey you got to drink in the old west.  The drinks are stiff and the locals are freindly.  Ask for Ricky to tell you his lotion boy story. You may see a thunderbird or two here during The Phoenix Open week.  You may have the time of your life with eveyone here. The jukebox is great and the tequila is well tequila.  Have fun!

data.title: Great Bar
data.text: We were looking for a place to grab a drink and we could hear this place from the street.  We had so much fun.  Great priced, no frills drinks.  Super friendly bartenders.  Fun hip vibe.  We went back the next night and the bartender remembered our drinks.

data.title: Bar from the Wild West
data.text: No dress code, mostly beers in bottles, a small bar and a mainly tourist crowd make this place a good one to wet your whistle. Once in awhile, some local idiots drink here, but you can play ping pong and pool and shuffleboard and the Bud Lights are always 3 bucks.  A good place to experience what Scottsdale used to be like in its heyday.
